result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew J Busarow was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court costs are waived. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.
Firearm warning given. Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew J Busarow

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Andrew J Busarow in court with attorney John E. German.  Dirk Christian Jensen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
BTC: 
Count 1- Withheld sentence, 24 Months Probation

Conditions:
No drugs, no alcohol
Comply with AODA programming and counseling
Maintain employment
Provide a DNA Sample + pay surcharge 
Court costs are waived
Pay $243 to ZCI from bond
FAW
VOTE
Sentencing hearing on May 13, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Payment received through Government Payment Express (charge card agency) - $200.00 posted 2-26-2016   16388006
While treated as being paid immediately, actual posting of payment will occur within 5-10 business days.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Andrew J Busarow in court with attorney John E. German.  Dirk Christian Jensen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
St- Plea to count 1.
Rights Given
P- Guilty
BTC: Finding of guilt on count 1. Order PSI. Report to ZCI after court. Must post an additional $200 by Friday February 26th @ 5pm today or Report to Racine County Jail at 5pm today.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 6, 2016 at 10:00 am.

BTC: Adj Report to ZCI after court. 
  Plea hearing scheduled for February 26, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant needs to obtain counsel. 
State does not object to a three week adjournment.
